page.title: 03SIMON DE MONTFORT
page.content: Fletching's chief claim to fame is that on the eve of the Battle of Lewes 1264 Simon de Montfort came with his barons to pray and receive the Holy Sacrament at Fletching Church. Their victory at Lewes led to the calling of a Parliament in which the germ of the House of Commons may be seen. A legend tells how a number of de Montfort's Knights, slain at the battle, were buried in full armour beneath the nave. Part of this floor is due to be lifted and replaced next year so further investigations may be carried out. A glance at the visitors' book in the church shows that this historic event attracts a steady stream of tourists from The UK, Europe , USA. {D Skan}
